STEP 2 - EVIDENCE-BASED TREATMENT SELECTION: Now I'll select treatments based on current clinical guidelines. - First-line treatment per guidelines: Observation and patient education about PVD-related floaters; urgent retinal examination. - Supporting evidence: Most floaters from PVD are benign and self-limiting, but new or persistent symptoms require prompt assessment to rule out retinal tears or detachment. - Patient-specific considerations: Underlying diabetic retinopathy increases risk; patient’s impact on quality of life warrants thorough evaluation. - Contraindications or cautions: Avoid unnecessary interventions without confirmed retinal pathology; avoid corticosteroids unless required for other indications. STEP 6 - PATIENT COMMUNICATION STRATEGY: - Communication approach: Clear, factual, empathetic; emphasize importance of vigilant symptom reporting. - Addressing patient concerns: Explain benign vs. urgent warning signs; reassure while stressing timely evaluation. - Adherence strategies: Encourage follow-up appointments; provide written instructions; ensure patient understands warning signs. - Family involvement: Involve family members if appropriate for support and ensuring attendance at follow-up.
